introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• Bletchley Park was the central site for British codebreakers during World War II.
• Alan Turing led efforts that cracked the German Enigma codes.
• The work at Bletchley Park is credited with shortening the war by two to four years.
• Turing also explored ideas that led to modern computer science.
• Thousands of intercepted messages were analyzed there each day.
question: The student wants to emphasize the significance of the work done at Bletchley Park. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: At Bletchley Park, codebreakers intercepted messages daily, relying on Alan Turing’s leadership.
B: British codebreakers, including Alan Turing, worked at Bletchley Park during World War II.
C: Breaking German Enigma codes at Bletchley Park may have shortened World War II by up to four years, highlighting the site’s crucial role.
D: Alan Turing’s exploration of computer science began at Bletchley Park, where he used mathematical methods.
explanation: Choice C makes the critical point that the decryption efforts significantly impacted the war’s duration, demonstrating Bletchley Park’s importance.
